text: Jerome Cooper (December 14, 1946 â€“ May 6, 2015) was an American free jazz musician. He was known as a multi-dimensional drummer. Cooper played balafon, chirimia and electronic tonal activator in addition to trap drums. He was born in Chicago, Illinois. Cooper died in Brooklyn, New York City from multiple myeloma, aged 68.Obituary, nytimes.com, May 14, 2015; accessed May 15, 2015. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American drummers Category:American jazz musicians Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:Deaths from multiple myeloma Category:Musicians from Chicago
title: Jerome Cooper
